COVID-19 negative certification subject to special conditions.

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Estonia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.
column3:
Self-isolation at own accommodation- subject to category.
COVID-19 travel restrictions have been lifted in Estonia. Travellers from an EU Member State or Schengen and outside the EU/Schengen Associated country are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.
column4:
THIS COUNTRY IS READY TO CONNECT TO THE EU DIGITAL COVID CERTIFICATE GATEWAY
Proof of vaccination: The vaccination certificate is valid for 9 months (270 days). After the booster dose, validity is extended to 12 months. For minors aged 12 to 18 years, certificates are valid for 15 months. Approved vaccines: Novavax, AstraZeneca, Pfizer-BioNtech, Moderna and Johnson & Johnson/Janssen.
column5:
Latest News: Estonia keep COVID-19 entry rules for travelers from third countries (Schengen Visa Info, 06.06.2022) Authorities abolish requirement to present proof of COVID-19 certificate to ease travel process (Schengen Visa Info, 15.03.2022)

International Restrictions:
*From within the EU: COVID-19 travel restrictions have been lifted in Estonia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.
*Transit:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Estonia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

Rules regarding airport transit visa requirements continue to apply.



*From Third Countries:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Estonia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel via neighbouring countries: Check country-specific Travel Advice for details on travel restrictions in the neighbouring countries Finland, Latvia, Lithuania and Russia.
*If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
